= getwords =

== Syntax ==
 stringlist := getwords( input_string : string );

== Parameters ==
 input_string : string
    A string containing zero or more words separated by spaces.

== Return Value ==
 stringlist
    Returns a stringlist where each element is a word from the input string.
    Returns fail if input string is null or invalid.

== Description ==
 The getwords() function splits a string into individual words using spaces as delimiters and returns them as a stringlist. Each word becomes a separate element in the resulting stringlist.

 Unlike getword() which extracts one word and modifies the original string, getwords() returns all words at once without modifying the original string.

 The function handles multiple consecutive spaces by treating them as single delimiters (empty strings are not added to the result).

== Example ==
 dilbegin parse_sentence(sentence : string);
 var
    words : stringlist;
    i : integer;
 code
 {
    words := getwords(sentence);
    
    sendtext("Sentence has " + itoa(length(words)) + " words:&n", self);
    
    i := 0;
    while (i < length(words)) {
       sendtext("  Word " + itoa(i) + ": " + words.[i] + "&n", self);
       i := i + 1;
    }
    
    quit;
 } dilend

 dilbegin check_keywords(input : string);
 var
    words : stringlist;
    keywords : stringlist;
 code
 {
    words := getwords(input);
    keywords := {"sword", "shield", "armor", "potion"};
    
    if (words.[0] in keywords) {
       sendtext("First word is a keyword: " + words.[0] + "&n", self);
    }
    
    if (words.[1] in keywords) {
       sendtext("Second word is a keyword: " + words.[1] + "&n", self);
    }
    
    quit;
 } dilend
